intro: Urostachys guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are characteristic of the Euphorbiaceae family.
